gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Commission for Higher Education (ICHE)(Data source)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: SCHOOLS_HIGHER_EDUCATION_ICHE_IN is a point shapefile showing the locations of 76 colleges and universities (including 2- and 4-year public institutions and independent institutions) listed on a directory obtained from the Indiana Commission for Higher Education (http://www.che.state.in.us/schools/interactivelist.shtml).

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This data set was compiled to create a GIS layer showing locations of colleges and universities in Indiana.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Data is from Commission for Higher Education

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This data set was compiled by Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability to a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the design or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS version 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 280 Kb

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: 2007 Indiana Commission for Higher Education Web site

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No checks for logical consistency were made.
All colleges and universities listed by the Indiana Commission for Higher Education have been included.

Street addresses for colleges and universities were obtained from the Web site of the Indiana Commission for Higher Education and are assumed to be accurate. Geocoding was performed by personnel of the Indiana University Architect's Office. Editing of some locations was performed by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap version 9.2, together with information obtained from Google searches, MapQuest (http://www.mapquest.com/maps/), and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project.
Automated geocoding typically produces locations that are generally within several hundred feet of actual locations.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Street addresses for colleges and universities were obtained by personnel of the Indiana University Architect's Office from a Web site of the Indiana Commission for Higher Education (http://www.che.state.in.us/schools/interactivelist.shtml). Using geocoding, an ESRI ArcMap shapefile was generated.

gmd:positionName.gco:CharacterString: Director of In-House Projects and Spatial-Project Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey obtained an ESRI ArcMap shapefile (IN_HIGHER_ED_FINAL.SHP) from personnel of the Indiana University Architect's Office. The shapefile contained a field named "Errors" that indicated that the locations of certain records were uncertain, based on the results of geocoding by personnel of the Indiana University Architect's Office. Using the ESRI ArcMap editing tool, IGS personnel edited the locations of the 13 points that had locational errors, using information gathered from Google searches, Mapquest, and inspection of the color aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project. The following fields were deleted from IN_HIGHER_ED_FINAL.SHP - Street, State_out, Latitude, Longitude, Tract_out, Block_out, Geocoding_, Zip_out, City_out, ID_1, ID, OBJECTID, and Errors. The field named "City" was renamed as "City_IN." The field named "Zone" was renamed as "ZIP." The field named "Address_Ou" was renamed as "Address." A field named "IGS_Edit" was added. The revised shapefile was saved as SCHOOLS_HIGHER_EDUCATION_ICHE_IN.SHP.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
ESRI ArcMap shapefile showing locations of colleges and universities

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcMap shapefile derived from a directory of colleges and universities obtained from a Web site of the Indiana Commission for Higher Education

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Street addresses of colleges and universities

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Commission for Higher Education, Colleges and Universities (http://www.che.state.in.us/schools/interactivelist.shtml)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
